channel.title: Solid State Drive
channel.description:
I've been wanting to get an SSD for a while now. My question is what size should I get, and what brand? Pricing does not matter to me as long as it is around $200.
This one was the first to catch my eye: http://www.amazon.com/Crucial-256GB-2-5-Inch-9-5mm-CT256M4SSD2/dp/B004W2JL2A/ref=sr_1_1?s=electronics&ie=UTF8&qid=1373947433&sr=1-1&keywords=Solid+state+drive+256GB

item.title: Solid State Drive
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

I don’t know how large uncompressed or compressed videos can be but as long as the SSD doesn’t become a permanent home for stuff except for Windows (like you said) then a SSD would be a great choice.

If you are willing to pay that much money for the 256gb one then that would be great for what you are doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Solid State Drive
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

Travas:

Solid state drives are extremely expensive right now (expect the price to lower within the next years), but for that reason, don’t expect to use it for massive storage. Most people use it to boot the operating system, but all their main storage is on a hard drive. If you are planning on doing that I don’t see a need to pay that kind of money for 256gb.

I’m actually trying to get into video making, so the only thing that would find a permanent spot on the SSD is Windows. FRAPS is a great desktop recording software, but it just requires a hefty read and write speed to prevent stuttering while recording.

Read full topic
